es.ubu.alu

Interface CommandSender

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TCPCommandSender

    public interface CommandSender
    Declares a function for each operation available in the remote board.

    To perform a certain operation, a command is sent indicating its name. In addition, depending on the operation, the necessary arguments are added so that the operation can be carried out.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    RPC

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  CommandSender.Color
      Each of the colors that can be illuminated using the RGB LEDs.
      static class  CommandSender.PWMDevice
      The intensity of the brightness of the LEDs in the Basic I/O shield can be varied using Pulse Width Modulation (PWM).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String COMMAND_LED
      Name of the command to change the color of the light emitted by the on-board RGB LEDs.
      static java.lang.String COMMAND_MSG
      Name of the command to show a string in one of the lines of the LCD.
      static java.lang.String COMMAND_PWM
      Name of the command to vary the intensity of the light of the LEDs in the Basic I/O shield.
      static java.lang.String SEPARATOR
      Character used as a separator between the command and its arguments.

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(byte row,
                 java.lang.String message)
        Send the command with the message that the user wants to show.

        The message is composed of a text string that will be shown in one of the lines of the display.

        Parameters:
        row - the row of the display to show the message.
        message - the text string to show.

      • sendMessageRow0

        Parameters:
        message - the text string to show.

      • adjustsPWM

        void adjustsPWM(CommandSender.PWMDevice pwmDevice,
                byte percentage)
        Send the command to adjust the duty cycle of the indicated device.

        The duty cycle is changed to the given percentage. Being 0 the minimum value, turning the device off. Or being 100 the maximum value, putting the device at maximum duty.

        Parameters:
        pwmDevice - the device to adjust.
        percentage - the new duty cycle.

      • adjustWhite

        void adjustWhite(byte percentage)
        Send the command to adjust the duty cycle of the white led device.
        Parameters:
        percentage - the new duty cycle.
